references.formattedCitation: Wikipedia: The Free Encyclopedia That Anyone Can Edit. Wikimedia Foundation, 2001. https://en.wikipedia.org.

description: The Arch of Hadrian is a monument in the form of a Roman triumphal arch, constructed by the citizens of Athens in AD 131 or 132 to honor the Roman emperor Hadrian.
details: The Arch of Hadrian was built by the city of Athens to celebrate a visit by the Roman Emperor Hadrian in AD 131 or 132. Its structure is similar to that of a Roman triumphal arch with a single opening, but the attic of the arch is occupied by a series of Corinthian columns supporting a triangular pediment in the center and an entablature on each side.

locations.details: Representative location for center of the Arch of Hadrian derived from comparison of Google Earth imagery to the information in Adams 1989.
